gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਅਾਪਾ ਖੋੲਿ ਗੁਰਦਾਸੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਰਬ ਮੈ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਕਰਿ ਮਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Aapaa Khoi Gurdaasu Hoi , Sarab Mai Pooran Brahamu Kari Maaneeai ?
translation: By contemplating and absorbing oneself in the name obtained by the blessings of a True Guru, and shedding the feelings of mine and his, one becomes a servant of the Guru. Such a servant acknowledges the presence of one Lord everywhere.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਸਟ ਅਗਨਿ ਮਾਲਾ ਸੂਤ੍ਰ ਗੋਰਸ ਗੋਬੰਸ ੲੇਕ ਅੳੁ ਅਨੇਕ ਕੋ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਪਹਚਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Kaasat Agani Maalaa Sootr Goras Gobansa , Ayk Au Anayk Ko Bibayk Pahachaaneeai ?
translation: As the same fire exists in all the woods, different beads are arranged in the same thread; as all shades and species of cows yield milk of the same colour; similarly the slave of True Guru achieves the wisdom and knowledge of the presence of one Lord in a

gurmukhi: ਲੋਚਨ ਸ੍ਵਨ ਮੁਖ ਨਾਸਕਾ ਅਨੇਕ ਸੋਤ੍ਰ ਦੇਖੈ ਸੁਨੈ ਬੋਲੈ ਮਨ ਮੈਕ ੳੁਰ ਅਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Lochan Sravan Moukh Naasakaa Anayk Sotra , Daykhai Sounai Bolai Man Maik Ur Aaneeai ?
translation: As all that is seen by the eyes, heard by the ears and said by the tongue reaches the mind, similarly the slave of the Guru sees one Lord residing in all beings and lodges Him in his mind.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਧ ਮਿਲੇ ਸੋਹੰ ਸੋਹੀ ਓਤਿ ਪੋਤਿ ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਿਲਤ ਜੋਤੀ ਸਰੂਪ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ ॥੧੦੮॥
transliteration: Gur Sikh Sandh Milay Sohan Sohee Aoti Poti , Jotee Joti Milat Jotee Saroop Jaaneeai ?108?
translation: The union of a Sikh with his Guru makes him utter Lord's name repeatedly and enjoins in Him like warp and weft. When his light merges with light eternal, he too acquires the form of light divine. (108)
